meanings.definition: Luckie (noun): A person who is fortunate or successful.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a real luckie; everything seems to go their way.
meanings.sent2: The lottery winner became a local luckie overnight.
meanings.sent3: The luckie found a four-leaf clover and a horseshoe on the same day!
meanings.sent4: She's like a luckie charm, bringing good fortune wherever she goes.
meanings.sent5: Being a luckie means always having a smile on your face.

meanings.definition: Luckie (adjective): Having good fortune or success.
meanings.sent1: It was a luckie day for the team as they won the championship.
meanings.sent2: The luckie cat statue is believed to bring prosperity and good luck.
meanings.sent3: The luckie coin always lands on heads, never tails!
meanings.sent4: The luckie star shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Wearing her luckie socks, she aced the exam effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Luckie (verb): To have good luck or success.
meanings.sent1: I hope to luckie my way through the job interview tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She luckied into finding a rare collectible at the flea market.
meanings.sent3: He luckied his way out of a speeding ticket by charming the officer.
meanings.sent4: The team luckied their way to victory with a last-minute goal.
meanings.sent5: If you luckie your way into the top prize, remember to share your joy with others.
